text: <@U0YNFB22X> This ACL feature, is a general feature of the fabric rite? I mean it's not specific to a particular chaincode type ( like java or go etc ). rite?
<@U1CS08EP3> Yes, but for java chaincode to use them the shim layer of java has to support it
ohkay, So the ACL support for Go chaincode is available. But for the java chaincode is a work in progress. is it ?
i use docker-tool box to test the java chaincode SimpleSample.java ,but failed. Do i have to do the test with vagrant? :joy:

<@U2CSGKHRS> Only peer and membersrvc are currently published to docker hub, so work with docker-tool box is not yet supported for Java chaincode development. Working inside vagrant environment should work.

attachments.fallback: [September 20th, 2016 8:50 PM] satheesh: <@U2CSGKHRS> Only peer and membersrvc are currently published to docker hub, so work with docker-tool box is not yet supported for Java chaincode development. Working inside vagrant environment should work.

text:
vagrant up   this command takes me too much time, and always goes wrong. it download so many file and maybe one error interrupt the process ,then it goes out with error. the vagrant ssh shows me the error.
i have tried this for more than ten times. everytime like that.
how could it happen? or it's just the problem about my enviroment.
May be its an environment thing, what error do you get when you do vagrant up ?
i asked my friend, he told me to use vagrant provision to try again.  it is ok

<@U2CSGKHRS|teddy> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/teddy/F2E2PJVS6/ss.png|ss.png> and commented: i use vagrant up and vagrant ssh,it seems ok, then i cd to fabric and use peer network login jim,it shows me cannot connect to 7051, what else should i do? i think it's done with vagrant up.
